text: 2.3 Let G = A ∨ ¬B, proven to be equivalent to F by equivalence transformations. G ≡ F ≡ ((B ∨ C) → ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C)) ∨ (A ∧ ¬C) (1., def. →) ≡ (¬(B ∨ C) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C)) ∨ (A ∧ ¬C) (2., de Morgan) ≡ ((¬B ∧ ¬C) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C)) ∨ (A ∧ ¬C) (3., commutativity of ∨) ≡ (A ∧ ¬C) ∨ ((¬B ∧ ¬C) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C)) (4., associativity) ≡ ((A ∧ ¬C) ∨ (¬B ∧ ¬C)) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C) (5., commutativity of ∧) ≡ ((¬C ∧ A) ∨ (¬B ∧ ¬C)) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C) (6., commutativity of ∧) ≡ ((¬C ∧ A) ∨ (¬C ∧ ¬B)) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C) (7., first distributive law) ≡ (¬C ∧ (A ∨ ¬B)) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C) (8., commutativity) ≡ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ ¬C) ∨ ((A ∨ ¬B) ∧ C) (9., first distributive law) ≡ (A ∨ ¬B) ∧ (¬C ∨ C) (10., F ∨ ¬F ≡ ⊤) ≡ (A ∨ ¬B) ∧ ⊤ (11., F ∧ ⊤ ≡ F ) ≡ A ∨ ¬B □
